Frame.Nav: Tall, 12.5 X 18 front tires add ground clearance and flotation capability to the 580 Super M + model.
A larger cab on the 580 Super M + gives the operator more leg room and more space to turn around.
The transmission-mounted hydraulic pump makes it easy to service the belt on the engine with no spline maintenance required.
The new 93-inch bucket on Super M + models offers loader capacity of up to 6,182 pounds (8.165 kg).
Larger engine displacement delivers increase torque rise for faster loader and backhoe cycle times.
Tier 2 emissions-certified engines from Case are quieter and smoother running and deliver increased peak torque for improved lugging ability.
The limited-slip front differential on Super M + models delivers greater traction, making it ideal for working in uneven and soft ground conditions.
With the in-cab switchable pattern change on models with Pilot Control, an operator easily can switch between backhoe and excavator control preference for increased productivity.
The exclusive, thumb-proportional controlled Extendahoe on models with Pilot Control allows for easy, relaxed operation and precise control.
More cubic inches gives the engine greater lugging capacity.
An electric, fingertip control on models with Pilot Control means the stabilizers are operated with little effort.
Large 21L X 24 rear tires are another reason why the 580 Super M + has extra flotation.

For the ultimate in operator comfort and control, M Series 2 loader/backhoes are available with Pilot Control as an option. To accommodate operator preferences, controls are infinitely variable in the fore/ aft and lateral positions .

An optional, auto-up stabilizer on models with Pilot Control allows the operator to raise the stabilizers while swiveling the seat to the loader position for fast and easy backhoe-to-travel operation.
With oil change intervals now at 500 hours, less time is spent on routine maintenance while more time can be devoted to working on the job site.
The 580 Super M features a larger diameter boom cylinder that generates 10 percent greater craning power for lifting and placing heavy objects, such as manholes.
On Power-Shift equipped machines, select the maximum travel speed desired. Then, the transmission will automatically shift up or down to match travel speed to load requirements.
Wrist rests that are height adjustable are a Case exclusive feature designed with maximum operator comfort in mind.
